subject: Programming
title: Grace Hopper and the Compiler
description: Learn Grace Hopper and the Compiler in one minute.

hook.text: Grace Hopper believed programmers should write in words, not cryptic codes.

buildup.text: In 1952, she built the first compiler â€” a program that translated English-like code to machine language.

discovery.text: Her colleagues called it impossible. They said computers couldn't understand English words.

twist.text: Hopper proved them wrong. Her compiler opened programming to thousands of non-mathematicians.

climax.text: She also popularized the term 'bug' after finding a moth stuck in a relay.

punchline.text: She taught computers to understand us.
